title: A pizza on wheels? See what this pizzeria owner has been dishing up
description: Inspired by his love of pizza and skateboarding, a pizzeria owner in the Netherlands dishes up an innovative pizza skateboard. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports how they are made.

title: Man killed by Kyle Rittenhouse was fatally shot in the back while bent forward, doctor testifies
description: The prosecution rested its case against Kyle Rittenhouse on Tuesday in his homicide trial after calling 22 witnesses over the course of six days, setting up the defense to potentially call Rittenhouse to the stand in his own defense.

title: Malala Yousafzai gets married
description: Malala Yousafzai, the Nobel Peace Prize-winning Pakistani activist, has gotten married, she announced on Instagram on Tuesday.

title: EU slams Belarus for lying to migrants as crisis at border with Poland intensifies
description: Thousands of migrants have set up makeshift camps in freezing conditions near the border between Poland and Belarus, as concerns over the potential for violence intensified on Tuesday.

title: Stephen Miller and Kayleigh McEnany subpoenaed by January 6 committee
description: The House committee investigating the deadly January 6 riot at the US Capitol announced on Tuesday a new batch of 10 subpoenas to former White House officials under President Donald Trump, as the panel charges ahead in seeking testimony and documents from witnesses relevant to its probe.

title: He navigates London's waterways on a floating bike to clean up plastic pollution
description: Dhruv Boruah travels London's waterways on his floating bike, cleaning up plastic pollution. CNN's Anna Stewart joined him, removing trash from Regent's Canal.

title: 'He's a sociopath': congressman's sister reacts to violent video he posted
description: Jennifer Gosar, Republican Rep. Paul Gosar's sister, reacts to a tweet the representative posted of a photoshopped anime video showing him appearing to kill Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and attacking President Joe Biden.

title: Republican congressman posts video depicting violence against Ocasio-Cortez and Biden
description: Republican Rep. Paul Gosar posted a photoshopped anime video to his Twitter and Instagram accounts showing him appearing to kill Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and attacking President Joe Biden.

title: GE is splitting into three companies
description: General Electric, the industrial conglomerate founded by Thomas Edison in 1892 is breaking up. GE announced plans Tuesday to split into three separate companies.

title: Public allowed to approach famous US memorial site for first time in nearly 100 years
description: For the first time in nearly a century, members of the public will be able to walk on the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier plaza and lay flowers before the sacred memorial site in Arlington National Cemetery on Tuesday and Wednesday.

title: Apple has no immediate plans to accept crypto as payment, Tim Cook says
description: Tim Cook is a cryptocurrency owner. But don't call him a bitcoin bull.

title: Watch CNN's full interview with Ethiopian PM's press secretary
description: CNN's Becky Anderson speaks with Billene Seyoum, the press secretary of Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed, about the ongoing conflict between the country's central government and armed groups of rebel fighters allied against it, including the Tigray People's Liberation Front.

title: Record-breaking 'tsunami' of gravitational waves detected
description: The ripples created by massive cosmic collisions have reached Earth after traveling across the universe for billions of years. Scientists have detected the largest number of these gravitational waves since the cosmic events were first discovered in 2015, according to new research.

title: Judge denies Trump's overnight request for injunction in executive privilege case, still needs to rule on main case
description: Former President Donald Trump's latest procedural attempt to keep secret documents from his presidency about the January 6 insurrection quickly failed overnight.

title: Yorkshire County Cricket Club investigating new allegations of racism
description: Former Yorkshire County Cricket Club academy player Irfan Amjad has said in a new interview with the BBC that he was racially abused by a member of staff when he was 16 years old.

title: Eating fat can lower stroke risk, study says, as long as it's the right kind
description: It's the type of fat, not the amount, that will raise your risk of stroke, a new study has found.

title: Analysis: Violence is now a 'joke' to this Republican lawmaker
description: On Monday, Arizona Rep. Paul Gosar (R) tweeted out a 90-second anime video in which his face is superimposed on some sort of animated hero, slaying a giant with Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's face on it and then flying in the air with two swords toward another figure bearing the visage of President Joe Biden.

title: Satellite images show China's most advanced aircraft carrier yet as experts say it could launch in months
Senate Republicans just got some very bad news
description: New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu, widely considered to be Senate Republicans' top recruit in the country, took a pass on the race Tuesday morning, a clear blow for a GOP that was hoping to build momentum off of their strong showing in the 2021 elections.

title: Whistleblower gets record $24 million for exposing Hyundai and Kia's safety lapses
description: The US auto safety regulator announced on Tuesday its first-ever reward to a whistleblower, handing out more than $24 million to a former Hyundai employee who provided key information about safety lapses at the South Korean carmaker.

title: Elon Musk doesn't get paid, buy stuff or pay taxes like you do
description: The world's wealthiest people have unfathomable riches. But there's a huge difference between wealth and income, and that's what makes Elon Musk's weekend Twitter stunt, polling his followers about whether to sell 10% of his Tesla stock, both fascinating and jarring.

title: California couple sues fertility clinic after IVF mix-up
description: A lawsuit filed by a Southern California couple says a Los Angeles-based fertility clinic implanted the wrong embryos into two women during in vitro fertilization procedures, resulting in a life-changing mix-up for two families who unknowingly gave birth to children that weren't theirs and raised them for several months.

title: Denmark had mostly returned to pre-pandemic life. That optimism was short-lived
Apple-1 computer goes on sale, with bids expected to reach $600,000
description: One of Apple's first computers is up for auction and it could sell for as much as $600,000.

title: World is on track for 2.4 degrees of warming despite COP26 pledges, analysis finds
description: The world is on track for 2.4 degrees Celsius of warming above pre-industrial levels, if not more, according to a new analysis -- despite countries' new and updated climate pledges, including those made at the COP26 summit in Glasgow, Scotland.

title: 'I wasn't just famous; I was famously sexy': Model Emily Ratajkowski on the dangers of being desired
description: In Emily Ratajkowski's new essay collection, "My Body, " the story of Audrey Munson, the teenager dubbed "America's first supermodel," serves as a powerful reminder of the perils of being idolized.

title: Jeff Bezos has fun with girlfriend's Leonardo DiCaprio moment
description: Watch out, Leonardo DiCaprio as Jeff Bezos may have a special delivery for you.

title: Extreme rhetoric by Republicans points to 'sickness' in politics
description: CNN's John Avlon discusses the extreme rhetoric used by top GOP members Ted Cruz, Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar.

title: Oscar Pistorius' parole process could start in South Africa
description: South African Paralympic athlete Oscar Pistorius, who was convicted of killing his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp in 2013, may soon be eligible for parole, according to corrections officials.

title: One woman's soul-destroying search to find her murdered sister's missing daughter
description: Arianna Fitts was just two-and-a-half years old the last time she was seen by family.

title: Fed warns China's property problems could hurt global markets and the US economy
description: Troubles in China's vast real estate sector could spill over to the global economy — including the United States, according to the Federal Reserve.

title: Princess Charlene returns to Monaco after months-long absence
description: Monaco hailed the return of Princess Charlene to the principality on Monday after she had spent most of the year in her homeland South Africa.

title: First images from NASA satellite which tracks climate changes released
description: NASA has released the first snapshots of Earth taken with its new highly sensitive satellite which is designed to capture high-resolution images of the planet and help track the impacts of climate change.

title: Why the first responding officer at the Ahmaud Arbery shooting didn't provide first aid
description: The first police officer to respond to the shooting of Ahmaud Arbery near Brunswick, Georgia, testified in court Monday he did not render first aid to Arbery due to the danger of the situation as well as his lack of medical training and equipment.

title: There is no fear on Wall Street. Only greed
description: The current mood on Wall Street can only be described in one way: euphoric.

title: Archaeologists discover ancient 'hangover prevention' ring
description: Raw eggs and Bloody Marys may be among today's hangover cures, but archaeologists in Israel have discovered an altogether different solution from the past: A gold and purple amethyst ring.

title: Pastor tackles armed man to ground during church service in Nashbville
description: Video shows a Nashville pastor tackle a man waving a gun during a service at the Nashville Light Mission Pentecostal Church.

title: Researchers uncover software flaws leaving medical devices vulnerable to hackers
description: Researchers say they have found more than a dozen vulnerabilities in software used in medical devices and machinery used in other industries that, if exploited by a hacker, could cause critical equipment such as patient monitors to crash.

title: New Chinese aircraft carrier is nearly equal to US carriers and could be ready to launch soon
Images suggest China is catching up to US military technology
description: A new Chinese aircraft carrier with technology nearly equaling the capabilities of its US counterparts could be launched as soon as February next year, according to an analysis of satellite imagery by a Washington-based think tank. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: Phones of Palestinian NGO workers infected with Pegasus spyware, rights groups say
description: Phones belonging to six people working for Palestinian NGOs were hacked with Israeli technology firm NSO Group's Pegasus spyware, rights groups say.

title: Steph Curry makes NBA history yet again
description: Steph Curry recorded 50 points and 10 assists for the first time in his career, overtaking Wilt Chamberlain as the oldest player in NBA history to do so, as the Golden State Warriors continued their blistering start to the season with a 127-113 victory over the Atlanta Hawks on Monday.

title: The airports that cross international borders
description: Those braving international travel in the Covid era are faced with navigating an ever-shifting maze of rules and restrictions.

title: Hear the story behind iconic image of minister's speech in the sea
description: CNN's Rosemary Church speaks with Simon Kofe, foreign minister of the small island nation Tuvalu, whose speech to the UN climate summit COP26 was widely shared as a stark reminder of the reality of climate change.

title: Polish luger says Beijing barrier crash could have been a 'tragedy'
description: Polish luger Mateusz Sochowicz said his accident while training on the Olympic track near Beijing on Monday could have resulted in "tragedy" if he had not taken evasive action to try to avoid a closed barrier.

title: How journal writing can help you 'Keep Moving' through loss and uncertainty
description: No one was more surprised than poet Maggie Smith that writing herself a daily pep talk during the unraveling of her 18-year marriage actually helped her feel better.

title: The fans taking a stand against Newcastle United's nation-state owners
description: It was Premier League club Newcastle United's first match of a new era. St. James' Park was packed to capacity with expectant fans and the sound of jubilant chants filled the air on the Tyneside on Sunday, October 17th.

title: Love actually is at the airport. Emotional reunions as US border opens
description: The United States opened its borders to vaccinated international travelers after nearly 20 months. CNN spent the day in three US airports talking to travelers and their families about what it's like to be able to see one another again.

title: CNN crew left stranded after being denied entry into Central American country
description: CNN's Matt Rivers takes a look at the latest Nicaraguan election that was reportedly won by Daniel Ortega, but global leaders around the world are calling a sham election.

title: Nicaraguan agents are brutally silencing critics abroad, say officials and alleged victims
description: The man's voice trembled as he spoke, standing in the middle of an open field in southern Nicaragua. He was tense, despite the cool breeze and the mid-morning sunshine. If any of his government colleagues knew he was speaking to foreign journalists, he would surely be imprisoned.

title: Anderson Cooper shares his son's favorite book
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper answers viewers' questions about his son Wyatt's favorite book and Anderson's favorite exercise at the gym. Watch Anderson Cooper Full Circle on Monday, Wednesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.
